title: Amma's Chicken 'Chaaps'
subtitle: Spicy and comforting chicken curry from home.

instructions.text: Clean the chicken, cut into large pieces. Set aside.
instructions.note: I prefer cutting one chicken thigh into 2 or 3 pieces.

instructions.text: Heat 1 Tbsp of ghee in a heavy-bottomed pressure cooker on medium heat. Add the onion and garlic. Sauté until onions turn translucent.
Add peppercorns, cashews, and curry leaves abd sauté for a few minutes until aromatic.
Transfer to a blender. Add cumin powder, red chili powder, raisins, coriander powder, garam masala, yogurt, cilantro and mint. Blend until very smooth.
instructions.note: We use a NutriBullet. The resulting paste should look very green because of the mint and cilantro.

instructions.text: In the same pan (on medium heat), add 1 Tbsp of ghee. Then add chicken and salt. Sear on all sides until lightly colored (around 10 minutes).
Add the masala paste from the blender. Mix well with the chicken. Close the lid, add the whistle weight, and cook for 2 whistles. Turn off the heat and let the pressure release naturally.
instructions.note: If you don't have a pressure cooker, you can simmer the chicken in a heavy-bottomed pan with a lid. Just add the masala paste and cook for about 20 minutes on medium heat, stirring occasionally.

instructions.text: Add about 1/2 cup water if needed. Cover and simmer on low for 30-40 minutes until chicken is tender.
Finish with garam masala, raisins, chopped mint, and coriander. Let rest covered for 10 minutes before serving.
